description: Borrowed from Middle French excepter, from Latin exceptus.

examples: There was nothing in the cupboard except a tin of beans.
Synonyms: apart from, except for, outtake, with the exception of

verbs.description: except (third-person singular simple present excepts, present participle excepting, simple past and past participle excepted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To exclude; to specify as being an exception.
examples: But this [ban on circumcision] must have been a provocation, as the emperor Antoninus Pius later acknowledged by excepting the Jews.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To take exception, to object (to or against).
examples: to except to a witness or his testimony
